alert.note: Alert for Inland Kenedy (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 3:27PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Kenedy and northeastern Willacy Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 326 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rudolph, or 13 miles northeast of Raymondville, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Norias and Rudolph. This includes US Highway 77 between mile markers 740 and 756. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
